name: Ibis London Luton Airport

reviews.text: Stayed here before an early flight- and was pleasantly surprised! Arrived early (just after lunch) and was checked in by a really friendly member of staff (Marie I think) who asked if we needed any wake up calls, or breakfast or dinner etc. and then went on to give us information about getting into Luton and to the cinema to waste some time as we didnt want to waste all afternoon in the hotel. The room itself was small, and had we been spending longer here, this may have been frustrating. That said it was clean and perfect for what we needed- somewhere to rest our head before an early start, at a very good price (less than £30!).
reviews.title: Excellent value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Stay at Ibis Luton

reviews.text: If you are using this hotel as an overnight stay before an early flight DO NOT rely on the incompetent Reception Staff to call you for an early wake up call.
reviews.title: Terrible Stay

reviews.text: I have worked in hotels for 6 years now, and to be so close to the airport they must realize many of the guests will have flights to catch and not receiving a wake up call is completely unacceptable.
reviews.title: Needs Must

reviews.text: I asked for a 6am call and asked Reception if my phone was working only to be told rather rudely that it was fine.... I was very unsure as i could not hear a dial tone.... I asked again and was met with the same reply. I trusted they could do there job.
reviews.title: Comfy bed in quiet room 10 mins walk from airport.

reviews.text: We recently spent a night before holiday flight and another on our return to UK. On both occasions we received excellent service from the friendly staff . Rooms are spotlessly clean, beds very comfy. Buffet breakfast excellent and set us up for the day. We will definitely use this hotel again for its good location and first class service
reviews.title: Ideal overnight stay

reviews.text: It is right next to the Luton airport, outside the town of Luton. If your flight is in the early morning or you just need one night between your flights it is a perfect place for you. Like other Ibis hotels that one is also very good. Due to many planes taking off, it can be noisy during the day. Taxi from the train station (Parkway) takes just a moment and cost GBP 3-4.
reviews.title: Ibis Luton
night before flight
reviews.text: Was given room 118.got to the room and had not been serviced..reception then gave us room 117. which had a large container blocking the window.Beds were very comfortable.

If you are looking for somewhere close to Luton Airport, prior to an early flight, this ticks all the boxes. Check in was efficient and friendly (the Receptionist even moved her own car to make space for ours in the busy car park). Rooms are small, but have everything you need - coffee (but no tea), free WiFi etc... The restaurant is basic, but perfectly adequate and they serve breakfast from 4am. The airport terminal is a 10 minute walk. There is a bus stop, but all the buses that passed us were full and the traffic is slow moving - so would recommend the early morning exercise option
reviews.title: Adequate for an Early Start

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel before our flight to Bucharest. Spotlessly clean, comfortable bed at a good price. The weather was very good at the time and we were able to sit out on the terrace in the evening. Food good. Unfortunately, can't be so positive about Luton Airport. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at a good price

aka: Ibis London Luton Airport Hotel Luton
description: Ibis Luton has an excellent view of the runway at London Luton Airport, which is 600 metres away. The centre of Luton is 10 minutes away. The Ibis is inviting, modern, spacious and air-conditioned, and has comfortable beds and functional bathrooms. Luton Airport Parkway Station is about 1km away. Regular trains reach London St. Pancras Station in about 30 minutes. Junction 10 of the M1 motorway is within easy reach and the Shopping centre is a 10-minute drive away.
